[Efficient Alchemy (Paragon)](/Feats.aspx?ID=1163) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Age of Ashes</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Alchemist" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=7" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises](/Sources.aspx?ID=15) pg. 76</row>

</column>

---

Your daily preparations are particularly efficient and plentiful. When using your infused reagents to create alchemical items during your daily preparations, you make a batch of three of a given item instead of a batch of two, or a batch of four if your field normally lets you create three of that item.

<title level="2">Paragons of Promise</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises](/Sources.aspx?ID=15) pg. 75</row>

The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor’s Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise’s trainers and records unlock all of the following uncommon class feats.

**Related Feats**: [Apex Companion](/Feats.aspx?ID=1160), [Aura of Unbreakable Virtue](/Feats.aspx?ID=1161), [Bloodline Metamorphosis](/Feats.aspx?ID=1162), [Emblazon Divinity](/Feats.aspx?ID=1164), [Enduring Debilitation](/Feats.aspx?ID=1165), [Golden Body](/Feats.aspx?ID=1166), [Song of the Fallen](/Feats.aspx?ID=1168), [Spell Mastery](/Feats.aspx?ID=1843), [Superior Sight](/Feats.aspx?ID=1170), [Ultimate Flexibility](/Feats.aspx?ID=1732), [Unstoppable Juggernaut](/Feats.aspx?ID=1631)
